title.narrative: Strengthening the Capacity of rural youth grassroots organizations by equipping them with the skills to advocate social issues of youth and rurual communities and influence local governance

description.narrative: This Action is designed to build on ACTED’s existing work with Youth Councils and Youth Clusters and enhance the capacity of these youth community-based organizations (CBOs) in Faryab province to influence the development of their communities, to advocate for youth and rural communities’ issues and to influence the policies of local government authorities. It will develop the capacity of existing youth CBOs to effectively identify youth needs, implement their own small projects to address needs, network together and advocate youth policies with government authorities and local stakeholders

Trainings for male and female youth CBO members • Community social works by female youth CBO members • Small grants programme • Inter-district sports tournaments • Extension of coverage of Radio Sahat to Kohistan district

young people from Pashtun Kot, Qaisar, Almar, Kohistan districts of Faryab, and Maimana city: both female and male aged 12-25 (approximately 180,000 people); It will directly benefit members of youth CBOs (currently 30,000 members in total, 7,000 of which are female); It will have a particular focus on young women, through the construction opf 3 female YDCs, and through 32,000 high school girls benefiting from activities in 16 girls’ high schools, 1,600 women benefiting from literacy training. The entire population of Kohistan district (40,000 people) will benefit from extension of radio coverage.
